statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Louisiana-Lafayette 67, New Orleans 64
article.story: LAFAYETTE, La. (AP) -- Louisiana-Lafayette outscored visiting New Orleans 25-9 during the last 9:45 and freshman Willie Lago hit a 19-foot jumper with 18 seconds left as the Ragin' Cajuns beat New Orleans 67-64 Saturday, A strong defensive stop in the final seconds helped the Cajuns (6-17, 4-9 Sun Belt) win their second straight home game. Elijah Millsap came off the bench to lead the Cajuns with 19 points and six rebounds. He was one of four scorers in double figures. Jamie McNeilly had a career-high 23 points and tied his career mark with seven rebounds for the Privateers (10-13, 6-6). Bo McCalebb added 20 points. The Privateers led 34-27 at halftime and were ahead 55-42 with 9:45 left. But with James Parlow sidelined with four fouls, the Cajuns began to take advantage with their four-guard lineup and chipped away. The Privateers continued to lead even though they did not make a field goal in the last 2:48. But Lago, who finished with 6 points, hit a clutch shot with defender Shaun Reynolds in his face to put his team ahead 65-64. Then McCalebb missed a jump shot with 5 seconds to go and Milsap got the final basket, a dunk.
